topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e32e16368727c5c001e4f#post_559e32e16368727c5c001e4f
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e31ef6368727678000ac5#post_559e31ef6368727678000ac5
They better not. This is legit why we cant have nice things.

All this talk about the "6th great extinction" has already been stressing me out enough and now this shit. Its like my fears are being realized.

I'm _actually_ pissed about this. [/bq]
We're already in the 6th great extinction; the only reason why we can't tell yet is because it hasn't traveled up the food chain yet.

Think about *most* extinctions like a domino effect, or whenever a stock market crashes, most of the time whenever a extinction happens it <insert> dying out causes <insert> to die out also which in return causes something else to die out which causes something else to die out.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e732c6368726351001e49#post_559e732c6368726351001e49
[bq="HJSDGCE"]!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/914/482/9e5.jpg![/bq]
I hate to break it to you, but we do have a general idea what dinosaurs sound like.  This is one of the reasons why channel awesome is full of shit, cause contrary to what nostalgia critic thinks archaeologists have recreated the vocal cavities of dinosaurs and while in all probability dinosaurs had different sounds it does give us the general idea.

Tl:dr; "we don't know what dinosaurs sound like" is a crock of shit.

"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e763763687268e9000e6c#post_559e763763687268e9000e6c
The theory behind the raptor horn is accurate, but the raptors in jurassic park aren't actually raptors.  Saying jurassic park raptors are raptors is like calling a hippo a dog.


Oh look it's squiggy in the shower:
